evidence: Momentum, as you may recall, is simply mass multiplied by velocity.
Impulse is defined as force multiplied by the time over which it acts.
We start with Newton’s second law, which tells us: Force equals mass times acceleration.
Acceleration is defined as the change in velocity divided by the change in time.
F times delta t equals m times delta v.
Impulse - that’s force times time - equals the change in momentum.
